text: (upbeat music)
- My name is Cami Tavares.

I am Senior Manager, Product
for Elastic Block Store at AWS,

and I started my career at
Amazon about eight years ago.

Actually, nine, because I did
an MBA internship in 2013,
and I started with Amazon Devices Group.

I did that for about two years
as a Senior Product Manager,
and then I moved over to AWS.
(upbeat music continues)
So, I actually was a lawyer in Brazil
before I got here,

and my motivation back then
was I just really wanted
to work more with businesses,
and so I went to business school,

and that's when I did my
internship with Amazon,

and I absolutely loved the
culture of the company.

I remember being shocked
by how much autonomy I had
in those three months that I was here,

and I knew instantly that
I wanted to come back.
(upbeat music continues)

I remember when I did
my interview for Amazon,
I remember being a little bit scared
of being asked questions about AWS

because the cloud was still a
little bit of a mystery to me.

And then, when I got here, I
became more and more interested

about what was happening in
that part of the business,

and I had the opportunity to
work on a collaboration project

with a team in AWS, and
after we launched that,
I decided to take the leap and move over.
(upbeat music continues)
The most exciting thing about my job,
I think, learning from customers

and hearing about the different
ways they use our services.
It's always a really exciting experience
when I get to spend time with them.
We were just at re:Invent last year,

and four days of back-to-back
meetings with customers,
it was so energizing.
(upbeat music continues)

The most important
skillset is the curiosity,
having this interest in exploring things,
understanding how things work,
because usually with tech roles,
there's this aura around it,

and people can be a little
bit intimidated about it,

and I've found that the most
successful people in this role

are the people that are
always willing to learn.

They're willing to check
their egos at the door,

learn something new,
disconfirm their beliefs,

always willing to explore
and learn something new,
and so I think that's the single
most important skill for this job.
(upbeat music continues)
